name: Cintya Huaire
title: Data & Policy Analyst | Policy Specialist | Digital Innovation for Migration & Social Protection
summary: Driven by a deep commitment to inclusive development, I combine expertise in economics, public policy, and data analytics to design scalable solutions. With 6+ years of experience across UNICEF, ILO, ICMPD, and the Peruvian government, I bridge complex data analysis with actionable policies in social protection, migration, gender, and digital transformation.

experience.role: Junior Project Officer, Modernisation and Digital Innovation
description: Developed modular Power BI dashboards to streamline data flows and improve decision-making across Mediterranean migration projects.
Conducted cost-benefit analyses of AI tools (e.g., CAT solutions), guiding resource allocation and technology integration.
Piloted AI-driven reporting solutions for high-level events, cutting reporting turnaround from days to minutes.
Mapped digital solutions aligned with Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) principles, fostering a culture of innovation.
Organized and analyzed child and forced labor data from household surveys, ILO, and other sources to support global research.
Contributed to methodological advancements in measuring forced labor and human trafficking.
Developed statistical models and visualization tools using R and Stata.
Supported workshops and field missions, enhancing knowledge exchange across regions.

experience.organization: UNICEF Latin America and the Caribbean
description: Designed and managed newsletters, webinars, and research briefs to support regional social policy networks.
Drafted sections of UNICEF’s flagship paper on care systems in Latin America and the Caribbean.
Strengthened knowledge management through MailChimp, SharePoint, and social media tools.

experience.organization: Ministry of Housing, Construction and Sanitation, Peru
description: Built national indicators database for 94,922 populated centers using R and Stata.
Contributed to a new rural–urban classification framework and co-authored flagship publications.
Delivered GIS analytics and dashboards used by national planners for prioritization and scenario planning.

experience.organization: Ministry of Economy and Finance, Peru
description: Designed new performance indicators to track infrastructure projects during the COVID-19 crisis.
Systematized administrative databases to support Treasury System reform efforts with the IMF.
Created dashboards to monitor sectoral projects valued at USD 2.56M and drafted legal decrees.
Improved the National Maintenance Program ('Mi Mantenimiento') to help 51,000 school principals track infrastructure spending.
Boosted compliance rates by 15% and won the 2019 Good Practices in Public Management Award.
Developed allocation strategies and multi-criteria methodologies for USD 101M in school funding.
Reduced intervention times by 50% by enhancing data quality and risk mitigation processes.
Conducted qualitative analysis on environmental and social projects.
Planned and supervised fieldwork, including survey design and data cleaning.
Supported mining projects with statistical and economic analysis.

other_experience.organization: Indecopi (National Institute for the Defense of Competition and Protection of Intellectual Property)
description: Researched challenges in intellectual property enforcement and proposed process improvements.
Contributed to a strategy that reduced case processing times by 20%.

other_experience.organization: Ministry of Foreign Trade and Tourism (MINCETUR)

publications.title: Impact of AI and Digitalisation on Indigenous Communities
publications.description: This research explores how artificial intelligence and digital transformation impact indigenous communities, examining both opportunities for development and risks to cultural preservation. The study provides recommendations for inclusive digital policies.

publications.title: Forging a Just Transition: Towards Green Jobs and Rights-Based Futures (pp. 169-217)
publications.description: A comprehensive analysis of the transition to green jobs and sustainable economies, focusing on rights-based approaches. This section examines policy frameworks needed to ensure environmental sustainability while protecting worker rights and social equity.

publications.title: Impact of women's participation in politics on the development of care policies in Latin America
publications.description: Master's thesis examining the correlation between women's political representation and the development of progressive care policies across Latin America and the Caribbean. The research analyzes policy outcomes in countries with varying levels of female political participation.

publications.title: Nuevas herramientas para analizar la ocupación del territorio peruano
publications.description: This paper presents innovative analytical tools for studying territorial occupation patterns in Peru, combining GIS technology with demographic data. The methodology provides insights for urban planning and infrastructure development in populated centers.

publications.title: Reporte de brechas y relevancias de centros poblados rurales
publications.description: Government report analyzing gaps and relevance in rural population centers across Peru. The study identifies infrastructure needs and development priorities for 94,922 populated centers, informing national housing and development policies.

awards.title: Fellow, 61st Graduate Study Programme, UN Geneva
Good Practices in Public Management Award (Mi Mantenimiento)
